chargeHist.descr: Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Cristopher C Jeffers

records.addlTxt: No violent or abusive contact w/victim - DMJ, CAJ, DMW, and TAW . Absolute sobriety, do not enter any establishments that sell or serve alcohol.

2:26 PM Prosecuting attorney Austin M Mogard in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Cristopher C Jeffers in court.  Attorney Emily M Nolan-Plutchak in court for Cristopher C Jeffers. Victim CAJ appears in court by telephone. DMJ appears in court.
Defendant waives the preliminary hearing. 
Attorney Nolan-Plutchak requests to modify bond today. CAJ makes a statement requesting the no contact is dropped or changed to no violent or abusive contact. DMJ makes a statement to the court regarding the modification and the charges themselves.
Final pre-trial scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 11:00 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing and Arraignment on August 18, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

9:07 AM Prosecuting attorney Daniel McGrath in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Cristopher C Jeffers in court. Victims appear in court would like to make a statement.
CAJ and DMJ makes statements as to why they are requesting a modification of the no contact condition.
Court denies the bond modification and leaves the bond as it is. Defendant requests a way to be able to see his kids while this is continuing. 
Court tells the defendant he needs to focus getting a job.

9:04 AM Prosecuting attorney Daniel McGrath in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Cristopher C Jeffers in court. 
Court finds probable cause to continue this matter. This will be bound over for preliminary hearing and arraignment.
Letter from victim requesting modification of no contact bond condition - CAJ
Letter from victim requesting modification of no contact bond condition - DMJ
Bail/bond hearing on August 1, 2022 at 09:00 am.
No contact with alleged victims, DMJ, CAJ, DMW, TAW or their residences. Absolute soriety. Do not enter any establishment whose primary purpose is to sell or serve alcohol.

$1,000 for DC & Battery/DA $2,000 for Threats to Law Enforcement
No contact with DMJ, CAJ, CMW, TAW or residence. Absolute Sobriety.
